title: Logan Mwangi: Bridgend mum denies murdering her son, five
article: A mother has pleaded not guilty to the murder of her five-year-old son who was found dead in a river last July. Angharad Williamson, of Sarn, Bridgend county, denied murdering Logan Mwangi, also known as Logan Williamson, at a hearing in Cardiff Crown Court. Logan's step-father, John Cole, 39, also appeared and denied allowing or causing the death of a child. Ms Williamson, 30, also denied that charge, as well as perverting the course of justice.Mr Cole, also from Sarn, admitted perverting the course of justice at a previous hearing, but denied murder. Logan's body was found in the River Ogmore in Bridgend county on 31 July 2021. A teenage boy, who cannot be identified due to his age, previously pleaded not guilty to Logan's murder and perverting the course of justice. He appeared at the pre-trial hearing via video link.Judge Dame Nerys Jefford said the trial would begin on 14 February and was expected to last for about six weeks.
